thread.section_title: Business Breaking News | Finance & Business News | News.com.au
thread.title: Stocks to watch on Monday

author: news.com.au
title: Stocks to watch on Monday
text:
STOCKS to watch on the Australian stock exchange on Monday, Aug 10:
ANN - ANSELL - down $4.84, or 19.56 per cent, at $19.91
Shares in gloves and condoms maker Ansel have fallen more than 15 per cent after the company flagged a weaker result for the year ahead. BEN - BENDIGO AND ADELAIDE BANK - down 52.00 cents, or 4.01 per cent, at $12.45 Bendigo and Adelaide Bank has lifted annual profit by 13.1 per cent in line with analysts' expectation. BHP - BHP BILLITON - down 2.00 cents, or 0.07 per cent, at $25.91 Mining giant BHP Billiton will cut 380 jobs, mostly from its Olympic Dam mine, after a review of its South Australian operations. CBA - COMMONWEALTH BANK OF AUSTRALIA - up $1.01, or 1.24 per cent, at $82.31 The Commonwealth Bank says it is considering several options to bolster its capital buffers. GEM - G8 EDUCATION - up 13.00 cents, or 4.15 per cent, at $3.26 Childcare centre operator G8 Education's first half profit has surged by 73 per cent, aided by a string of acquisitions. JBH - JB HI-FI - Up $1.76, or 8.97 per cent, at $21.37 JB Hi-Fi will launch a $15.2 million share buyback after lifting its full year profit 6.35 per cent following a big increase in second half sales. KMD - KATHMANDU - down 2.50 cents, or 1.61 per cent, at $1.53 Kathmandu chief operating officer Mark Todd has resigned from the company, and will be replaced by chief financial officer Reuben Casey. NAB - NATIONAL AUSTRALIA BANK - up 34.00 cents, or 1.04 per cent, at $33.16 National Australia Bank has lifted its quarterly cash profit nine per cent to $1.75 billion after a fall in bad debts offset the impact of tough competition among lenders in Australia. NEC - NINE NETWORK - down 3.50 cents, or 2.43 per cent, at $1.405 The Nine Network has won the rights to broadcast NRL games from 2018 to 2022 in a deal worth $925 million.
